estion "Express \(0.6\overline{333}\) as a common fraction," we need to follow these steps:
Identify the non-repeating and repeating parts of the decimal.
Set up an equation where \( x \) equals the decimal \( 0.6\overline{333} \).
Multiply \( x \) by a power of 10 that converts the repeating part to a whole number, considering the length of the repeated sequence.
Subtract the original \( x \) from the scaled value obtained in step 3 to cancel out the repeating part.
Solve for \( x \) using the equation derived from step 4.
Simplify the fraction obtained by expressing it in lowest terms if necessary.
